intro: Gynochthodes elliptifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf gynochthodes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features small, elliptical leaves that are usually arranged oppositely along the stems. Its flowers are typically white or pale green, with four petals and a prominent tubular corolla. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests.
